pages.text: Cassinoceras is a nautiloid from the Ordovician period whose fossils have been found in North America. They had a short, laterally compressed shell, loosely having a triangular shape. These nautiloids could grow up to 30 cm in length and would have been free swimmers, preying on smaller invertebrates.
